archbyshop archedeacon io whitgifte nothing lesse contrary thing haue spoken yet chap diuision c pag sect pag sect nowe reason also sort place ephesian corinthian ioyned together function hath giftes fit apte discharge annexed gyuen vnto wherevpon apostle metonomie doth call apostle prophet c giftes bycause haue alwayes giftes ioyned graunted man denie reason thus syllogisme without forme function sufficent church haue gift needefull eyther ministring worde sacrament gouernment churche function reckened paule ephesian paule calleth nonlatin alphabet nonlatin alphabet deacon elder haue giftes needful either gouernment church either else ministring worde sacrament therefore function sufficient church superfluous thing make office ther gift furnish haue rather idol officer therefore asmuch gift falleth line nnctions altogither vaine vnprositable thing bring office function church besides io whitgifte saye function hath giftes apt fitte discharge annexed giuenin sense euery function sayde haue giftes discharge vnto meane function giftes meete god hath power bestowe true meaning giftes annexed function necessitie whosoeuer called function muste also haue giftes moste vntrue experience dothe teache euery man hath giftes according function althoughe bee lawfully vnto called touching externall calling warde calling none knoweth god himselfe man owne conscience put mee remembraunce whiche maister bullinger writeth anabaptistes lib cap wher confuting reason vse proue christian ought haue magistrate bicause christian perfect themselues gouerne themselues therfore neede subiect superiour authoritie saith thus solent autem anabaptistae libenter ea imaginari animo suo fingere quae nunquam bullinger lib aduersus anab cap fueru line ne que extant aut posthaec futura sunt anabaptistes willingly vse imagine conceyue thing myndes whiche neuer hath bene hereafter shall bee euen say vnto imagining giftes perteyning euery function vnto function whiche hath one must necessitie haue phansie whiche neuer shall reasoning else vse argument superioritie ecclesiasticall estate anabaptist vse ecclesiasticall ciuill magistrate answere bullinger answered excepte blinded pertinacie might easily see selfe iuste cause shoulde bee magistratesidem superiours moreouer god dothe tie giftes certayne definite number name title office bestoweth pleaseth commoditie church vpon meete vse name title soeuer called wherefore assertion eyther vnaduisedly auouched else doth conteyne secrete poyson yet vttered sayde ground haue layde thus answere argumentthe deformed argument c mode deede bad boye vse sophismes forme thing onely sufficient saluation conteyned scripture al thing aue maria conteyned scripture therefore thing aue maria sufficient saluation onely men indued reason cosrardmongers london indued reason therefore costardmongers london onely men besides maior particular agaynst forme syllogisme first second figure shorte maior haue woorde onely medium minor left therefore conclusion followeth except sayd minor function reckened paule ephesian c haue giftes needefull ministring woorde sacrament gouernment church yet argument force ex solis particularibus syllogisme manner forme therefore woorthie answere vntill better framed although could say vnto function haue giftes necessary function bycause mencioned haue giftes necessary also apostle rehearseth corinth lykewise could answere moste function according owne opinion perpetuall time therfore reason good reason likewise apostle hath made eyther place perfect diuision office euen time churche first corinthian chap leaueth euangelistes pastor byshops deacon widdowes fourth ephesian deacon widdowes worker miracle c hath lefte perpetuall paterne office name eyther twoo place conclude could tell god hath lefte church authoritie appoynt name office shall conuenient profitable authoritie church hath also beginning vsed appoynting catechistes lector lyke superfluons moste necessarie office profitable churche time wherein chap diuision c pag sect may thus reasoned men may make crect new ministeries must eyther giue giftes dischardge assure men shall haue giftes god whereby may able answere neyther giue giftes assure men giftes necessary discharge function therefore may make erect new ministeries io whitgifte first new ministery erected among minister appoynted gouerne rest haue chiefe direction chosen superioritie vpon god farre man iudge hath bestowed giftes meete secondly necessary appoynt office able giue gyftes incident vnto man might appoynt office therefore sufficient appoynt person god hath indued giftes meete office office may persones meete execute obserued argument soone answered chap diuision c pag sect last conclude agaynst made diuised ministeries archbyshops archbeacons sortethe men may adde ministeries may also take away belong one authoritiethe take away ministeries god hath placed churche therefore cannot adde placed churche one apostle appoynt bishop tertulli de praescript dyd seuerally manyfest onely example timothie titus sundry whereof maye reade ecclesiasticall history namely policarpus made bishop smirna iohn selfe excellencie respect magnificence place excellent minister euer famous place archebishops bishop onely therefore cause shoulde archebishop euer minister congregation worthy iames euer citie ought haue whyche say intellerable speake withoute tolerable reason master deane hys prebendary good churche englande generally seuerall church particularly take paine one moneth companion whereof office haue plat forme framed shall declared come seigniorie neyther name office come christian prince detesteth antichrist called antichristian vpon soeuer bestowed wherevnto example tendeth queenes maiestie wise men may easily coniecture smelleth papisticall cauillation scilicet giue hir maiestie authoritie preach administer sacramentes bycause acknowledge hir lawfull authoritie ecclesiasticall cyprian erroneous councelthe wordes cyprian discussed tom con carth carthage wherein cyprian himselfe also chiefe author errour recite word doe finde neque enim quisquam nostrum episcopu se esse episcoporum constituit aut tyrannico terrore ad obsequendi necessitatem collegas suos adigit cum habeat omnis episcopus licentiam libertatis potestatis suae arbitrium proprium tanqua iudicari ab alio non possit cum nec ipse possit alterum iudicare sed expectemus vniuersi iudicium domini nostri iesu christi qui vnus solus habet potestatem praeponendi no ecclesiae suae gubernatione de actu nostro iudicandi neyther dothe v make selfe bishop bishop enforceth fellowes necessitie obeying tyrannicall feare bicause euery bishop hathe freedome libertie free iudgement owne power iudged neyther selfe iudge another bishop let v wayte iudgement lorde iesus christ alone hathe power bothe place v gouernment churche iudge dooing absurde thinke cyprian word generaily vnderstanded kinde iudgement bishop thing shoulde left owne free libertie discretion free controlement heretike otherwise criminous shall iudged man lefte onely iudgement christe word cyprian vnderstand themthe meaning cyprian take authoritie iudgement aswell synodes archbishop cyprian therfore meaneth word themselues teache one bishop tyrannically rule ouer pleasure abridge libertie vttering iudgement especially synode rashly condenme cyprian councell propounding controuersie rebaptization requireth euery man iudgement therof protesting condemne excommunicate dissent matter therevpon sayth neque enim quisquam nostrum c meaneth tyrannicum compeil bishop necessarily agree opinion inall thing word licetia libertalis potestatis suae arbitriu propriu line nt iurisdiction iudgement opinion one man necessitie bounde frame selfe iudgement opinion therein hath freedome libertie neyther man allowe authoritie archbishop touching iurisdiction euery bishop church hath free gouernment ouer stocke al thing belongeth vnto thing happen end archbishop intermedleth serue referred synode word cyprian respect derogate thing iurisdiction archebishops concerning iurisdiction bounde lawes themselues execute lawes made owne priuate authoritie parliament prince neyther controle worst minister dioces obserue lawes rule prescribed therefore excepte meaning haue bishop minister free lawes subiection superiour prince whiche moste like doe knowe take saying cyprian sense doe sure word doc fauour anarchie may reader easily perceyue cyprian sayth vnto euery one portion flocke appoynted sayth truely yet dothe thereby exempte bishop pastor minister obedience subiection lawfull gouernours due obedience dothe hinder dutie owing towards flocke place alleage cyprian seconde booke first epistle haue omitted whiche goeth declareth cyprian meaneth word haue recited wordes caeterum scimus quosdam quod lib epist semel imbiberunt nolle deponere nec propositum suum facile mutare c know certayne neuer laye away haue taken neyther easily chaunge purpose doe reteyne certayne thinges peculiar selues whiche haue vsed yet breaking bonde peace concorde among fellowes wherein neyther compell man appoynte lawe since euery gouernour hathe free iudgement wyll gouernment churche shall render accompt deede lorde cyprian wordes sheweth opinion concernyng suche beeing minister worde sacrificed idol hathe done thus speaketh stephane whome writte epistle haec ad conscientiam tuam frater charissime c followeth caeterum scimus c haue recyted wherein cyprian signifieth wyll take vpon iudge condemne church whiche haue contrarie custome keepe bonde peace meaneth vndoubtedly suche church bishop nothing doe else manyfest within owne charge woulde haue suffered suche thing done thys place answereth cyprian hathe spoken touchyngtract cap sect receyuyng ministerie suche sacrificed idol whereof haue spoken chap diuision c pag sect whereas sayd preseruation vnitie one must ouer al cyprian shewethli epi vnitie church conserued hauing one bishop ouer agreement bishop one another writeth church knit coupled togither giue bishop consenting one compounding controuersies manyfest done one byshop prouince byshops whych neere place schisme heresie sprang speaking appeasing controuersies schismes shewing dyuers bishopsli epi drawen heresy nouatus sayth vertue strength christian decayed line anguished portion priest giue place vnto rumes shipwrackes fayth another place sayth therfore deare brother plentyfull body companyli epi line pr line est g line ue mutuall concorde bande vnitie ioyned togither company author heresy goe destroy rent flocke christ rest helpe profitable mercyfull shepheards gather togither sheepe lorde whereby many fest appeasing composing controuersies heresy thought fitte one bishop hande many coulde conuemently assemble togither according daunger heresie sprang depe roote taken like take io whitgifte bishop agree one whit worse haue superior may called togither put minde office duetie neyther doth cyprian deny affirmeth thoughe chiefe cause vnitie consente agreement bishop one another yet haue one shall haue chiefe care thereof must needes great helpe thervnto euen society bishop deuided among themselues variance superiour compounde controuersies archbishop doe take vpon neyther decide controuersiehowe farre archbishop deale controuersies doctrine religion owne authoritie therein doe deale eyther according lawes churche prouided purpose else expecte newe parliament synode neyther doth bishop dioces otherwise meddle suche matter common consent churche appoynted vnto yet neuer otherwise taught bishop hys owne diocesse archebishop prouince mighte vse persuasion ende controuersies execute lawes prouided kinde deciding controuersies priuate authoritie knowe none church englande wherfore al allegation vayne surely cyprian time determining suche controuersies committed pastor seigniorie euery parishe neyther doth cyprian make mention suche matter yet gouernment diuersitie time state church consideredtract haue noted chap diuision c pag sect time authoritie giuen one might remoue cause controuersies rose see bishop di line e taketh matter controuersie rise church within dioces minister elder decision perteyneth archebishop taketh away bishop may appeare thirde epistle first booke sayth sort ordeyned equall right euery man cause heard fault committed little sayth meete handle matter maye haue accuser witness faulte whiche although spoken whiche fled affrike vnto rome yet reason generall dothe aswell serue agaynst ecclesiasticall person whych wyll agaynst bishop rome clayming interest hearing appeales thence prouince englande large accuser witness may brought parte parte reason maye serue better agaynst westminster hall one place serue whole prouince whiche shoulde see rest husband duty wiues case nouatian heretike beeing condemned cast church affrica consent bishop able embassage sent obteyne receyued comunion fellowship agayne line oeth afterwards rome beeing likewise repelled time getteth himselfe certayne fauoured heresie chosen bishop rome cornelius beeing bishop pastor godly minded whervpon commeth cyprian vrgeth one bishop one priest church bicause rome two wherof one wolfe ought haue bin considering one churche whiche gathered vnder gouernment cornelius therefore place cyprian gathered ought one bishop one citie multitude professor require well gather selues togither one congregation taught one man muche lesse serue proue one whole diocesse prouince graunte latter time went simplicitie pri line itiue churche tooke scripture ye foudations whervpon ye church may build doth giue ground stand leadeth wayes cannot follow come except learned besides haue meanes abilitie haue bookes cited ye least smalest portion church know thing true alleaged haue said could know yet haue nothing stay themselues vpon quiet conscience allowing ye doctor woulde faine haue like therfore might haue much fitly dedicated booke archbishop ouer whole prouince io whitgifte seuerally answere argument reader may better vnderstand pith first denie argument bicause neither modea argument dis line sigure first must cal memory third figure wold seeme place minor may negatiue secondly conclusio premiss al rule sillogismes concluded according former proposition shoulde haue sayde thus ergo archbishop schismes true conclusion false sillogisme thirdly minus extremum subiectum conclusionis argument praedicatu seing therfore argument hath true forme respect denie vntill better framed chap diuision c pag line none yt apostle time thus may appeare either ordeined apostle authoritie else without besides authoritie without besides authoritie therefore condemned yt bicause time starie vp without warrant apostle ordeine vse followeth io whitgifte proofe former minor argument bene good would haue yet sufficient proofe minor owne bare word may easily reiected barely affirmed least ignorant reader shoulde thinke shifte matter wyth suche quidities vnderstand set side deformed face argument come matter thinke meaning controuersies compounded apostle time without archbyshop ergo maye lykewise neede archbishop controuersie whether church bound kind external gouernment time vsed ye apostle time haue proued hetherto bethe office archbyshop ye apostle ad cor line ltra que id tim epi ad tit euseb lib cap epibha lib tom said afterwards meane time giue vnderstand althoughe apostle name archbishop among yet authoritie office gouernment direction diuers church matter doctrin discipline ended controuesies repressed error kept quietnesse ordeined bishop visited appeareth act cor line epistle timothie titus euseb lib cap declareth iohn euangelist returned pathmos visited gouerned sundry church ordeined minister like doth epiphanius report peter pontus bithinia lib tom office hath archbishop therfore though name archbishop among apostle yet office function notwithstanding part office apostle ceased consisted planting founding church throughout ye world yet part gouernment direction church remaineth still committed byshops therefore saith ambrose ad ephe apostoli episcopi sunt apostle byshops ambro ephe bicause bishop succeede preaching word gouerning ye church shal also proue good authoritie among apostle themseluessuperioritie among apostle tymes one chiefe though called archbishop suppose seeme straunge vnto state church couenient haue like euery prouince diocesse ierome firstierom aduers ioni lib booke aduersus iouinianum sayth thus yet among twelue one chosen head appoynted occasion schisme might remoued least ye wipe away accustomed deprauing authour ioyne vnto testimonie caluine institution cap writeth thus tweluecaluine apostle one among gouerne rest marueyle nature requireth disposition man haue euerie companie although equall power yet one gouernour whome rest may directed court without consull senate without pretor colledge without president societie without master bucer likewise booke de regno christi hath wordes see perpetuall obseruation church euen frombucer apostle themselues hath pleased holy ghost among minister whome especially gouernment church committed one haue chiefe eare church whole ministerie shoulde go care diligence cause name bishop peculiarly giuen chiefe gouernors church c againe vpon ephe sayth alledged paule act called men bishop minister whe called theidem minister ephesus miletum yet bicause one among rule chief eare church name bishop properly belong vnto neither age alwayes considered vertuous learned haue example timothie yong man thus see euen amongst apostle themselues church tymes chiefe authoritie ouer rest ende especially schismes contention might compounded rest might directed whiche chiefe partes archbishop office therefore haue sayde falleth flat ground yet still affirme beene apostle time yet might haue bene lawfully necessarily tymes chap diuision c pag sect antioch rose great daugerous heresie maner infected al church shaked foudation saluation god childe whether faith sufficient iustifie without circucision matter disputed side could agreed ordein archbishop archprophet archapostle one chief referre coutrouersie vpon wil depend nothing lesse would haue controuersies ended one deuine euer shall fitter purpose paule amongst send abrode remedie home great charge long iourneyes might haue without charge one foote set doore sende paule barnabas ierusalem lesser townes send church uniuersities london desire help determining controuersie paule barnabas ambassage desire iudgement mind one must needes answered luke came know resolution church yet apostle whereof euerie one better able sharpely see iudge incorruptly without affection archbishop euer therefore great aboundance ouerflowing giftes god tyme controuersyes might haue beene referred without daunger error vnto one onely ministerie one aboue thought good giftes lesse daunger error make archbishop deciding controuersyes auoyding schismes thing straunge able see reason soeuer apostle controuersie bene referred certaine would haue giuen true sentence io whitgifte tolde archbishop himselfe alone doth take vponsupr diui determin matter doctrine controuersie contention arise either determineth matter according law rule alreadie church established else consent prince doth set order prouinciall lawfull synode chiefe one apostle like assembly according haue declared therfore speach might well haue bene spared argument also faultie two respectes first ab authoritate negatiue non facto ad non ius good neque diuinis ne que humanis neyther diuine humane matter secondly go conclude vniuersall doctrine one particular singular example time matter tollerable moreouer rather iustifyeth assertion euidently proueth eueriethe example c rather parish within selfe hath absolute authoritie ende controuersies behoueth weightie matter resort chiefe church ierusalem example therefore well consider directly neither doth respect proue chiefe gouernour guide rest supplie place office archbishop hath chap diuision c pag sect shew one man tymes may assured pronouncethe archbishop hath thanke gentlenesse truth euery question shall arise shall make somwhat fauorable archbishop presently although found one could erre yet could consent matter shoulde lie vpon hande seeing apostle could erre matter would take vpon seeing meanes iudgement church contemned iudgement one man controuersie strong pull vp error rooted men mind iudgement consent many iudgement many apt either confirme truth confute falsehoode euident paule doth holde forth buckler agaynst frowardnesse certaine authoritie church io whitgifte take great paynes fighting without aduersarie bicause otherwise seeme lacke matter lengthen booke therfore deuise matter owne striue agaynst hath affirmed earnestly seeke place ouerthrowe hath bene tolde twise alreadie neyther archbishop taketh vpon compounde controuersies doctrine himselfe alone neyther office doe archbishop authoritie thisthe authoritie archbishop church church prouide lawfull ordinarie meanes vnitie obserued church contention schismes cut religion order church whole consent church agreed vpon mainteyned euery bishop prouince doe duetie according principall charge take agaynst haue yet spoken thing deuise selfe improue man affirmeth verie shifting dallying chap diuision c pag sect furthermore distinction came vp apostle tyme commeth passe neuer mention nay commeth passe euen paule epistle voyces founde holde paule apollo cephas whiche are1 cor sayde cause archbishop ordeyneth cleane contrarie doctor commendeth place farre se line ched improue office archbishop two three prophet haue expounded scripture appoynteth rest iudge whether haue done well io whitgifte contend name archbishop apostle tyme haue yet proued office superioritie among cleargie notwithstanding denie negatiue reason proueth nothing haue bene oftentymes tolde place cor farre fetched speaketh gournment andt c faulteth admonition vnapt allegation scripture discipline externall pollicie church expounding scripture reason cal paule saith cor prophet line duo aut tres loquantur caete line dijudicent let two three prophet speake let iudge ergo speaketh agaynst archbishop surely authours admonition bene detected vnskilfull allegation scripture shoulde haue much doe poynt euen fewe haue vsed almost one rightly truely applied paule place corinthian sheweth hearer must iudge doctrine prophet whether according worde god whiche commended actes archbishop chap diuision c pag sect howe commeth passe paule rome prison looking euery day shuld giue vp last breath comended vnto church perfect absolute ministerieephe howe oft hath beene repeated standing fiue partes wherein maketh mention one worde archbishop sayeth ministerie able enterteyne perfect vnitie knitting togither church thing speake rather crie much step archbishop apostle time io whitgifte oft haue alledged place ye purpose like youthe place eph per line ect pater line would bestow one whole side iesting answere place apostle confesse reciteth office temporall apostle prophet ministerie vntruly also haue surmised let passe office whiche paule reciteth office archbishop conteyned though named namely vnder apostle pastor haue shewed chap diuision c pag sect say apostle ordeyne archbishop haue indeed sayd againe one worde writing pray tell v howe shall hold church vnwritten verity papist part true say cannot tell answere vnto answere apostle haue left perfect rule ordering church written therefore reiect tradition cause yet bicause superfluous need degree archbishop mentioned scripture also manifestly oppugned bold hard line speech say line et petegree archbishop apostle time apostle themselues io whitgifte must answere still zuinglius answered anabaptist like obiection haue answered papist make tradition necessarie vnto saluation therefore reiected bicause worde god conteyneth thing necessarie saluation make office part decencie order ecclesiasticall gouernment pollicie whiche admitteth alteration tymes person require particularly expressed scripture diuerse thing kinde haue prooued may seeme straunge matter thing fauouring papist vnwritten verity may call remembrance caluin sayth traditionscaluine vpon wordes cor quemadmodum tradidi vobis instituta tenetis denie sayth tradition apostle written c itract haue recyted speaking ceremony expressed worde may see wise learned men scrupulous apostolicall tradition written made necessarie vnto saluation neyther learned man contrarie iudgement therefore archbishop may well brought apostle tymes without daunger admitting vnwritten verity papist haue yet proued eyther name office archbishoppes respect oppugned worde god therefore feyned chap diuision c pag sect time doctor hath forgotten question proue archbishop whereas testimony alledgeth make mention onely bishop therefore may rather confirme state bishop realme archbishop answere vnto shal appeare place much name archbishop mentioned except name bishop shall founde little agreement betwene bishop dayes called bishop time v io whitgifte doctor remembreth authours admonition aswell denie office bishop office archbishop hee ignorant proofe one confirmation therefore vseth suche testimony perteyne whiche nature place hath hitherto alledged muste vnderstande spake name nowe according promise speake office whiche farre distant bishop moste thing confounded let v nowe heare performe promise chap diuision c pag sect consequently although doctor thought one whiting boxe haue whited two walles establishing archbishop bishop testimony father yet shall plaine going defend left vndefended io whitgifte wordes pleasure vsuall c smal weight god thanked lesse truth chap diuision c pag sect let v therfore come first examine ieromes reason one must ouer rest testimonie men onely regarded spoken either authoritie scripture reason grounded scripture otherwise speak without either scripture reason line asily reiected alleaged one sayth chosen ouer rest bringeth remedie vnto schismes least euery man sayth drawing himselfe breake church piece would aske church great daungerhere co found monarchie tyrannie done pleasure iust one man one carieth error one pulleth one piece another piece third part also isnot tha line one gouerne lawe harder draw many error one many caried away affection one euidentyour similitude hold water little quickly troubled corrupted beeing much easily ecclesiasticall monarchie thing kept peace nay rather hath bene thevntruth cause discorde well spring horrible schisme seene decretalsdecret par c q apost alibi passim themseluesa good line tor contentio line admit yet peace without truth execrable thousande contention stryking two flintes togither commeth fyre may sometymes contention truth hidden darke peace maye come light peace naughtinesse wickednesse buryed vnder ground doth appeare io whitgifte ierome man singular learning great credite among learned matter hystorie hee reporteth one byshop wast c descredueth author cannot answe line e placed ouer rest cause beleeued withoute reason popular friuolous argument let reader againe consider whether maner vaine reason shake credite authour cannot otherwise answere reason vse popular aristocraticall gouernment church come among people easily transferred state common weale peraduenture breede misliking ciuill gouernment would haue ecclesiasticall inconuenience mischiefe able remedie meane time vtterly ouerthrowt c ouer line line ecclesiasti line queenes authoritie ecclesiasticall matter giuen vnto hir lawes god hereafter shall proued state must eyther popular aristocraticall must one supreme gouerner church matter wil come reason first aske whether churche great daunger done pleasure lust one man one carieth errour c eyther ignorantlydifference betwixt king tyrant wilfully confounde monarchiam tyrannie betwixt king tyrant one difference king ruleth according lawes prescribed rule according equitie reason tyrant doth list followeth owne affection contemneth lawes sayth sic volo sic iubeo stat pro ratione voluntas commaund pleasure standeth reason therefore vse reason ouerthrow lawful monarchie onely proper wicked tyrannie eyther closely accuse gouernment church england tyrannie maliciously subtile dealing confounding state procure thethe ecclesiasticall gouernment church tyrannicall lawfull misliking heart subiects neyther prince prelate land ruleth pleasure lust according lawes order appointed common consent whole realme parliament lawes monarchie neuer hitherto good subiect hath mislyked therefore grounde false rest building stand hath bene sayd archbishop hath absolute authoritie giuen vnto doe thing alone lust lawe prescribed doe howe proceede dooings moreouer churche englande god name bee praysed therefore hath poyntes necessarie doctrine certainly determined ceremony order e line presly prescribed whiche neyther archbyshoppe byshoppe maye swarue according whiche must bee directed obseruing whiche also dutie constreyne line ee vnder whosoeuer shall wilfully line ubburnely seuer himselfe obedience eyther archbyshoppe bishoppe suche matter may iustly called schismatike disturber church respect saying cyprian nowe true neyther doo heresyesli line epist aryse schismes spring thing hereof priest god obeyed ieromes like maner ecclesiae salus summi sacerdotis pendet contra luciscrianos dignitate cui si non exors ab omnibus eminens detur potestas tot ecclesia efficiuntur schismata quot sacerdotes safetie churche dependeth vppon dignitie highe priest vnlesse singuler peerelesse power giuen manie schismes church priest say harder draw many error one c whiche truethe gouernment one lawe safe many without lawe one ruleth gouerneth lawe minde man euen best may ouerruled affection cannot lawe wherefore wicked man directed lawe gouerneth indifferently multitude withoute lawe bee neuer godly moreouer one godly wise learned man muche hardly moued errour multitude whiche naturally prone bent whome onely philosopher singular diuines also haue noted great inconstancie disposition moste vnmeet line gouernethe line ilitude water returned agaynst replier similitude water holdeth little water grauelly stonie well ryuer soone troubled corrupted multitude water fennishe marrishe groundes againe little water running ryuer fourde tymes pure cleare great quantitie standing puddelles bee short water little spring cundite heades beeing safely locked vp inclosed stone leade minister greate releefe whole city muche pleasaunt hardlyer corrupted lesse troubled great water thames therefore little water proceeding good fountaine stone leade kept thing may hurt hardlier putrifyed corrupted fennishe water whole countrey mightie pooles yea thames selfe one wise prudent man gouerned directed order lawe corruption errour gouernement whole multitude people sorte soeuer bee say ecclesiasticall monarchie hath beene cause discorde c aunswere hath beene cause contrarie vntill suche tyme turned tyrannie ecclesiasticall storyes wryters may appeare namely two cyprian ierome decretall part c quaest noted margent nothingthe place c line ed c maketh archbishop agaynste forme gouernment vsed archbyshoppe churche englande plaine manifest wordes bothe name office archebishoppe mainteyned approoued wishe learned reader woulde peruse ouer parte gratian shoulde easily perceyue faythfulnesse alledging authority thoughe somewhat tedious yet vnlearned also may haue taste dealing sette downe canon conteyned parte gratian councell pope martine hee cyteth canon per singulas prouincias oportet episcopos cognoscere c euerie prouince bishoppes must knowe theyr metropolitane haue cheefe authoritie ought doe nothing withoute according olde auncient canon oure forefather whiche cause also metropolitane muste take vppon nothing presumptuously without councell bishoppes councell antioch hath per singulas prouincias episcopos singulos scire oportet c euery prouince bishop must know metropolitane gouerneth haue chiefe care whole prouince therefore haue cause must resort metropolitane citie c rest canon manifestly attributeth superioritie gouernment archbishop metropolitane euen church denieth metropolitane denied archbishop absolute authoritie determine thing matter doubtfull determined lawes order churche whole realme hath consentedcan apost canon apostle quoted margent episcopos singularum gentium rest muste submitte themselues nothing without knowledge asmuch require canon made apostle wherof seeme doubte name authoritie archbishop greater antiquitie would gladly haue reason saying ierome true aboue elder io whitgifte without doubt forget selfe else would reason manner archdeacon inferior elder therefore byshop superior elder respect see sequele reason neither yet likelyhoode besides vntruely report hierome hee speaketh deacon archedeacon manner deale suerly marueyle vtter manifest vntruthes hierome saye yet argument nothing though archedeacon inferiour minister whome call elder yet doth hee acknowledge superioritie bishop minister besides place haue alleaged aunswere admonition saith thus epistle presbyter episcopus aliud ad euagr line tati aliud dignitatis est nomen one baptized decreed throughout whole world one minister chosen set ouer rest vnto whome whole care churche aperteyn seed schismes taken away thinke yt ment pastor euery towne purpose shoulde ierome saye pastor euery seueral towne beginning line thorite ouer flocke without constitution moreouer euery seuerall congregatio many pastor priestes ouer one shold placed chief ierome speaketh bishop must gouerne priestes procure vnitie bee kept among therfore iurisdiction must necessitie extend many parish bicause ouer many pastor sayth lykewise care whole comitted vnto epistle ad euagrium vttereth meanyng plainly sayeth priest choose one among themselues whome placingide ad eu line gr higher degree called bishop wherby apeareth yt authoritie ouer many pastor therfore ouer many congregation denie euery presbyter minister worde seuerall flocke declareth euidently example vsed souldiers choosing captain though captain common souldiour yet line hus preferred ruleth gouerneth reste souldiers euen bishop minister equall yet chosen degree guide gouernoure gouernour say elect ist priest minister therfore diuers congregation dothe yet euidentely appeare woordes epistle one afterwardes chosen rule reste remedie schismes least euerie one drawing himselfe churche shoulde breake bookeibidem idem contr line lucifer contra luciferianos sayeth except chief authoritie giuen one tot essent schismata quot sacerdotes would many schismes priest place certain ieromes meaning haue one prouince dioces ouer rest proprely called bishop haue chief authoritie least euery man owne seuerall parish permitted list might end fyll church schismes vt tot essent schismata quot sacerdotes surely vnpossible expounde ierome otherwise aske helpeth archbishop c much necessarie haue one bishop ouer diuers priest euery seuerall dioces auoyding schisme cotention also necessarie euery prouince haue archbish line p direction diuers bishop auoyding schisme amog therfore sayth ierome epistle ad rusticu gret authority dignitie bishop rome answer nothing alderogateth fro archbishop denied euery bishop euery minister equal quoad ministerium quoad ordinem politiam ierome saith eiusdem sunt meriti sacerdotij merite priesthod yt ministerie office preaching word administring ye sacrament al one authoritie also toward vnder iu line isdictionmetropolitanes c ierome tyme doth say ye one bishop hath ample large iurisdictio tha contrarie manyfest ieroms tyme wer metropolitanes archbishop c may read defe line se apol edit pag obscure townes doe derogate nothing authoritie bishop see oftentimes come passe yt bishop seate obscure town diuers place england yet bishop iurisdiction dioces whit lesse respect place canterburie far inferior london therefore ieroms meaning yt place neither addeth thing taketh thing away worthinesse authoritie office bishop wheresoeuer bishop citie towne authoritie worthinesse erasmus scholies vpon epistle hierome hath word certe metropolitanus erasmus habet aliquid dignitatis c surely metropolitane hath dignitie iurisdi line tion aboue bishop therfore maketh bishop base city equal rest referred vnto deacon place preferred minister doth maner make equall bishop place sayeth minister succede place apostle byshop place christ thing therefore byshoppes minister equall wheresoeuer preferred deacon erasmus speaketh good earnest howsoeuer iested weth obscure one minister superior another one byshop another byshop one office one function shoulde saye lorde maior london aboue sherifes therefore one sherife superior another io whitgifte difference betwixte respect preaching gospell andthe example line proueth line ritie among yt minister worde administring sacramentes respecte gouernment therefore among minister worde sacramentes may degree dignitie superioritie one may rule ouer another grounde assertion ouerthrow doth example paul proue euidently euen example lorde mayor doth proue superioritie gouernment among citizen thus haue reasoned lord mayor authoritie aboue rest citizen declareth superioritie ciuill state one subiecte another euen paules superioritie ouer timothie titus minister declareth may superioritie state ecclesiasticall one may ought subiect another thus haue applyed similitude truely applyed chap diuision ansvvere admonition pag sect titus superioritie ouer al ye pastor minister whichtitus superioritie creta potestatem alphabet common elder minister worde seemeth appropriated vnto one io whitgifte though notable famous doctor ditch c yet pleasant cleare riuers men liberall science paule timoth hath woordes nonlatin alphabet c derogate nothing fro thing haue alleaged iustifieth signifieth rule gouernment yet iustine signifieth one chiefe rule gouernment ouer rest beza noteth vpon woordes ti aduersus presbyterum c praeterea beza notandu est ex hoc loco timotheum ephesino presbyterio tum fuisse nonlatin alphabet id est antistitem vt vocat iustinus furthermore noted place timothie presbyterie colledge minister sure haue followed mine owne booke faythfully truely neither haue omitted one worde maketh eyther agaynst therefore haue vniustly charged mee booke follow printed anno wherein wordes office archbishop agree knowe speake contrarie gouernment churche vntrue vndoubtedly haue offended thing much lenitie whiche fault euen father authoritie hemingius giueth ciuill magistrate acknowledge moste due would ambition singular person vve giue minister place aboue deacon bishop aboue minister archbishop aboue bishop vve see cause inequalitie vvhy one minister aboue another minister one bishop degree aboue another bishop deale dioces archbishop aboue archbishop keepe order duely truely church according true nature definitio order authoritie augustine lib de ciui ordo est parium disparium que rerum sua declaration good wyll honor one beareth another reade writeth thinke maruel place cape r line ader haue read haue read ouer booke martyr think dyd neuer read diligently foxe haue beene hasty snatche archebishoppe tyme bothe apostle prophetes euangelistes bee therefore archbyshoppe muste supplye wante apostle c howe commeth passe hee wayteth tyme whylest dead commeth lyke vnto one borne tyme lyke vntymely hastye fruite whyche seldome neuer holesom one come apostle prophetes place requirerh authoritie hym whych ordeyned apostle c whyche lorde institution worde whiche whiche desire shewed hereof haue spoken large io whitgifte vnknowne suche willing learne apostle coulde presente themselues appoynted gouerne church apostle paule titus creta therefore reason soone answered apostle dyd appoynt byshoppes church whyche planted gaue vnto suche authoritie euident therin made theyr successours withoute sufficient testimonie warrant spirite god therfore talke proue nothing chap diuision c pag lin sect necessitie deanes acknowledge haue already spoken touching prebendaties shall haue occasion speake worde hereafter earles duke suche lyke title honour ciuill neyther dothe followe bycause may newe title newe office broughte ciuill gouernment therefore maye attempted church god hath left greater libertie instituting thing common wealth churche muche diuers common wealthes dyuers formes common wealthes good falleth office dignity whyche good one common wealthe good whych good monarchie good aristocratie whiche good aristocratie good popular state sayde churche whyche one vniforme hathe lawes forme gouernment thorough worlde common wealthes also conuersions one forme beeing chaunged whiche true churche god io whitgifte acknowledging acknowledgyng necessitie deanes c greatly materiall depende vpon example king saule first king israell say nothing yet materiall suche difference betwixte ciuill gouernment common wealth externall gouernment churche one many thinges may vsed example vntrue yt external forme gouernment church ought one selfe thorough worlde tymes place shall hereafter fully appeare still woulde haue reader notetract kynde gouernmente churche doe allowe ioyne wyth assertion gouernment common wealth muste bee framed according gouernmente churche hangyngs house chap diuision c pag sect erasmus authoritie saith titus archbishop haue answered chrysostome sayeth iudgemente many bishoppes committed titus vntrue haue yet spoken one worde haue declared sorte vnderstanded yet vppon wordes bishoppe hardly conclude whyche dothe titus hadde gouernmente many bishoppes one thyng saye iudgement many committed vnto titus thing say gouernment many io whitgifte shall answere serue lyra well haue answered answere erasmus truste authority wyth godlie reader shall haue credite bycause reuerende father dothe herein confirme opinion whose iudgement singular vertue learning ought estemed number suche neyther haue answered doe answere answere wordes chrysostome verie poore shifte make suche distinction betwixte iudgemente gouernment else haue iudgemente manye byshoppes commytted vnto hym haue gouernment shewe difference doubte woulde haue doone coulde wherefore authoritie chrysostome remayneth vntouched confirmeth answere greeke scholiast borrowed wordes neyther would haue thus dalyed place looked vppon chrysostomes wordes affirmeth paule may thinke bin disposed haue delt purpose cause coulde haue sayde muche secrete priuie nippes whereby line u reader would willingly defende false cause shall neuer able deface worthie prelate maye perceiue conclusion toucheth neere tooke great care tyme answering weake reason thus concludeth beseeche take sodaine answeres good parte reason iudgement made buylde vp vveake pull downe stultitia c pag sect doctor delight thus oppose men authoritie authoritie holie ghoste reason grounded scripture caluine doth openly mislike making name proper peculiar certaine holy ghost maketh common mo caluines wordes sayth degree honoure ministeriehere defendeth admonition shifteth line auilling doctour would gather archbishop vnderstanded apostle aboue euange line ste euangeliste aboue pastor pastor aboue doctor aboue elder ruleth onely neded neuer haue gone popishe hierarchie seke diuersiti line degree might haue founde paule whereas vpon caluines wordes sayth paule one chiefe amongest io whitgifte oppose men authoritie ye authoritie ye holy ghost reason ar grounded scripture oppose authoritie reason spurne order whiche holie ghoste hath placed churche shamefully abuse scripture mainteine errours example wherof present text alledged admonition passe ouer silence condemning therby leudenesse abusing abuse name authoritie holie ghoste wring wreste scripture vntollerably falsifie authority learned men corruptly alledge say depraue discredit writer haue bene notable instrumentes churche christe maintaine erroneous opinion false doctrine wherewith endeuour subuerte verbi ministris idem que officium sunt tamen bonoris gradus although selfe office common minister worde yet degree honor wordes disproue equalitie minister admonition affirmed confirmed portion scripture caluine interpreted cor verse degree honour apostle tyme among idem selfe office caluine affirmeth nowt c contra line ie himselfe likewise see howe vnlike vnto selfe euen fewe lynes first saye caluines meaning apostle aboue euangeliste euangelist aboue pastor c confesse chieftie euen among apostle consisted labouring suffering rest giftes excellent rest omitte contrariety whiche plainenesse master caluin line wordes hath driuen inequalitie confesse haue bene office notwithstanding speake owne head without warrant god worde argueth maye superioritie among minister churche requireth necessarily nothing done minister childe tenne yeare olde line oe well lawfully man wherewith booke contenteth selfe io whitgifte straunge collection booke common prayer maynteyneth line preaching ministery bicause appoynteth number psalmes prayer chapter read whiche may occupie time spent preaching would haue prea ching onely neyther reading praying publike congregation doe thinke chapter prayer read occupie long time persuaded commeth profite rea line ing praying meane first haue example church place tymes agaynst meane time long spent praying reading may preaching also longest tyme b line communion houre spende houre better praying hearing scripture read meane thirde shall haue oc line asion speake heereafter say dothe muche maynteyne vnpreaching ministerie thatt c seeketh deface bo line ke without reason poynt requireth nothing necessarily done minister whiche childe ten yeres olde doe well lawfully man wherewith booke contenteth selfe requireth besides playne distincte reading administration sacramentes maye childe ten yeres olde doe also seeth purpose set deface booke thoughe chyldishe reason bicause chylde may reade booke dothe therefore maynteyne vnpreaching ministerie mighte well saye bicause chylde ten yeres olde reade byble translated englishe therefore byble translated englishe maynteyneth vnpreaching ministerie argument non caus line chap diuision c page sect neyther shifted saying done want able men minister may easily answered first want sufficient minister ought cause men breake vnchaungeable lawes god whych none may made minister church whych teache none minister sacrament whyche doe preache although might graunted whych thing would denie inoughe sufficient minister may appoynt godly graue man line oe nothing else reade reader churche yet may graunted may make one nothing reade minister gospell one may haue power minister sacrament io whitgifte vnchaungeable lawe god none may minister sacramentssome may minister sacrament line preache c line rysost doe preache scripture authoritie haue chrysostome hom cor vpon word non enim misit christus vt baptizarem c saythe thus sayth forbidden sent doe doe whiche necessarie euangelizare enim perp line ucorum est baptizare autem cuiuslibe line modo fungatur sacerdotio preach gospel euery man may baptise line priest ambrose vpon word chapter sayth thus non omni line qui baptizat ambrose idoneus est euangelizare verba enims line lennia sunt quae dicuntur baptismate c euery one baptizeth apte preache gospell word spoken baptisme vsuall conclude apostle peter commaunded sundrye psalmes diuers example gospell craued like thinges christes handes obteined desyre howe many prayer booke common prayer skilleth long cannot proue godly necessarie euery prayer make petition seuen petition one onelye bestowed waye howe farre therefore reason godlynesse reason godly reasonable reader may line dgeall thing prayed tende glorie god thinges praye tende glo line ie god authour reason vpon place muste thus paule sayth man cannot preach sent meaneth extraordinarie sending therefore man may preach vnlesse extraordinarily called therevnto consequently minister baptisme except euer preached minister sacrament baptisme true baptisme soeuer celebrated vsurper office hath answere intrusion sacrament thereby defiled harde matter shew primitiue church laye men suff line dlay men su line fred preach euseb lib cap preach know euseb sayeth origene lay man sent arabia preach gospell also church alexandria likewise cesarea although demetrius bishop alexandria founde faulte origene beyng laye man shoulde preache presence bishop cesarea yet manifest allowed laye men preach bishop present chapt diuers example shewed euelpis laranda paulinus iconium theodorus synada custome church time laye men might preach euen presence bishop haue erred applying place paule saying laye men may preache woorde vpon occasion consequently baptise chap diuision c pag sect know diuers blame without proo line enter difficulty difficulty question therefore soth enter answerer setteth downe considently maketh matter truthe baptisme whether minister minister whether one haue calling calling wherein notwithstanding doth onely often handling one thing confounde reader himselfe also forgetteth question propounded although grauced sacrament doth depende vpon yet hath line intended would haue woman may baptise one thing say baptisme ministred woman good effectuall thing say lawfull woman minister baptisme man doubteth baptisme ministred hereticall minister effectuall yet thinke doctor say therefore hereticall minister may baptise lawfull herctikes baptise churche therfore men must take hede doctor sayth vsurpe called vnto must also take heede receyue function charge vpon whereof capable although therevnto called io whitgifte mo difficulty question wel determine therfore bene beste eyther haue spoken el haue handled substantially scarcitie matter reason argueth weakenesse fayntnesse cause passe ouer woordes go aboute proue woman may baptise onely withstande errour substance beyng sacramentes dependeth vpon man respect say baptisme ministredbaptisme true baptisme though vulawfully ministred woman true baptisme though lawfull woman baptise baptisme also ministred heretiks true baptisme though vsurpers office augustine affirmeth baptisme laye men placeaugust lib contr epist parmea ca alleaged although sayeth vsurped without necessitie giuen man man giuen cannot sayde giuen although may rightly sayde rightly giuen say baptisime ministred hereticall minister member churche notwithstanding good effectuall see cause rather ministred laye men member partes churche chap diuision ansvvere admonition pag sect bucer censure vpon communion booke speaking ofbucer order appointed priuate baptisme writeth thus constitution thing godly appoynted vvoulde god theydifferring baptisme expedient vvere obserued especially baptisme infant differred therby dore opened vnto deuill bring contempt baptisme whole redemption comunion christ thorough sect anabaptistes hath much preuayled vvith many c pag sect page bucers censure vpon comunion booke cited allowaunce hath touching priuate baptisme consequently baptisme woman may bucer although otherwise learned hath grosse courtesie grosse absurdity may haue bene credite cause shewed writing published knowne wherof men may doubt whether euer wrote wrote whether corrupted whose hand came would take aduauntage bucers testimonie considering witnesse publike person haue brought studie stationer shop mought haue bene common others well whereby stile manner writing gesture countenaunces thing go come head fecte might better know whether true bucer io whitgifte grosse courtesie shewe worthie learned man modestiethe reuerece c giueth learned men charitie would haue bene rashe answere whiche well speaketh opprobriously obiecting vnto errours call grosse absurdity reuerence giue learning learned men contrary opinion haue sometimes heard papiste burst rage bucer beyng pressed authoritie first professour gospell euer hearde churlishly vse reuerent learned paynefull sounde father also earnest zelous professour causeth lesse regarde speake heare bitternesse agaynst neuer zealous excellent well bucers reason touch quicke would haue bene reasonablie answered without spyte rather haue considered authour nothing woordes affirmed playne termes auouched zuinglius woordes recited booke bucers forth coming shewed affirmeth nothing therein contrary bookes published speciall occasion offred speake matter controuersie therefore credited chap diuision c pag sect although wil say may bucers yet seemeth straunge bucer onely contrarie learned writer nowe also contrary learned antiquitie contrarie practise churche whilest tollerable estate allowe woman baptizing de virgin velan tertullian sayeth permitted woman speake churche teache baptize worke man much lesse minister lib de baptis place alleaged disallow chap diuision c pag lin li de merit remis peccat cap contra e line pist parmen lib cap augustine although minde child could saued without baptismean vntruth yet time necessitie called doth allow eyther baptisme priuate house woman daunger woman hasted carie child vnto church although seeme allowe baptisme lay man time necessitie yet also mentioneth woman baptisme doubteth whether childe shoulde baptised againe baptised laye man io whitgifte doth augustine disallow baptising woman priuate house vttereth suche thing place quoted margente still counterfeit ende falsifying seconde booke contra epistolam parmeniani cap dothe onely say lay man may baptise tyme necessitie also addeth ministred without necessitie yet notwithstanding baptisme appeareth word haue sayde althoughe vsurped meaneth baptisme lay men without necessitieaug lib contra epist parm cap giuen man man whiche giuen sayde giuen althoughe maye rightly sayde lawfully giuen dothe make manyfest two prety similitude following whiche omitte auoyde tediousnesse learned reader maye place augustine soone perceyue errour saye minister substance beeing sacrament neyther dothe eyther place eyther disallowe baptisme woman priuate house affirme ad fortunatum saythe thus inaug ad fortunatum necessitie bishop priest minister founde daunger requireth dothe constrayne least shoulde departe lyfe gratian de conse disti thus reported mulier quamuis docta sanctum viros comuentu docere vel aliquos baptizare non praesumat nisi necessitate cogent line let woman although learned godly presume teache men assembly baptise excepte necessitie constrayne canon inhibiteth woman preache baptise open churche publike assembly sufficient answere place neyther dother impugne thing affirmed answere chap diuision c pag lin author admonition obiect necessitie saluation tyed sacrament meanes men confirmed olde errour man saued without baptisme whiche deede true muste thought done necessitie vpon great extremitie whereof order god hathe let shoulde done congregation minister gospell broken yes verily wyll say although infant dye without baptisme assuredly damned whiche moste false yet oughte order whiche god hathe set hys churche broken sorte saluation men oughte beare vnto v glory god whiche consisteth order kepte ought muche deare time controuersie coulde betweene glory saluation saluation ought fall glory may stande io whitgifte yet auoyding errour sufficient cause debarre infantes fromthere necessitie bap tisme though necessitie saluation tyed sacramentes baptisme excepte therein ioyne anabaptistes outwarde sacramentall signes seales god promise whosoeuer refuseth shall neuer enioy promise althoughe necessitie saluation tyed sacrament whosoeuer hathe externall signes shall therefore saued yet tyed vnto none saued willingly wittingly voyde partaker circumcisto figure baptismegenes necessitie ioyned vnto whosoeuer lacked counted reckenedmark amongst people god nothing table page shoulde prouided papist neyther constraynedly customable communicate mysteryes saluation whiche cannot otherwise ment compell punishment come lordes table howe much cause shoulde haue say seuere punishing requyre negligence common sort oftner frequenting lordes supper lamentable punishment appoynted place well executed therefore sayde thinke conuenient discipline due execution verie necessarie thing also woulde haue reader marke alledge proofe canon apostle much doubted haue beene apostle epistle either clement anacletus chap diuision c pag sect also may rise another doubt former wordes moses boke number seeing maketh exception cleane may sayd depart feele themselues meete receyue therefore depart three foure mo feele themselues meete disposed purpose wherevpon may seeme neyther reason compell come feele themselues meete reiect feele good disposition preparation themselues answere whereunto must vnderstande vncleannesse whiche moses speaketh men could easily auoyde whervnto might fall sometymes necessarie duetie handling theyr dead rule charitie bounde burie sometymes touching vnwares dead bodie sitting place vncleane bodie sitten touching suche thing whiche lawe iudged vncleane thing cannot alledged nowe churche many withall discretion able proue examine themselues haue excuse may church withdrawe themselues holy supper lorde say meete may answered vnto owne fault meete receyue holy sacrament supper meete heare worde god meete partaker prayer church one also boldnesse dutie lawfulnesse speake church discretion examine selues say true shall shewed lawfulnesse may offer themselues prayer hearing worde god may also offer themselues vnto lordes supper whome soeuer lorde communicate himselfe preaching worde vnto refuse communicate himselfe receyuing sacrament whosoeuer god householde family neede afrayde come lordes table doubt lorde feede whatsoeuer member bodie christ may assured receyueth life christ head well artery conduites supper lorde preaching worde god muste needes followe receyuing depart church communion celebrated proceedeth eyther vaine supersticious feare growing grosse ignorance themselues holy sacrament else intollerable negligence rather contempt neyther one shoulde either borne nourished either permitting three foure communicate alone else letting depart go easily away great fault ought seuerely punished io whitgifte neither differ substance set take cut friuolous vaine excuse vsed eyther neglect contemne holy communion certaine circumstance vsed altogither agree first vncleannesse moses speaketh ceremoniall externall therfore may easily auoyded weakenesse fayth vncleannesse lyfe may ought time withdraw men communion naturall inward therfore greater difficultie shunned secondly christian man true member church may take benefiteme mete communicate may admitted hearing fro line pray line prayer hearing worde god whiche yet diuerse respectes meete receyue holy communion indeede praying preaching bee meanes prepare men make apt communicate besydes weake fayth corrupt iudgement ignorant right vse sacrament may admitted prayer hearing worde may instructed fides ex auditu fayth commeth hearing may receyuingrom supper thirdely man may presume receyue supper except hath first tryed examined himselfe ought come hearing worde god may first learne examine himselfe wherfore true lawfulnesse may offer themselues prayer hearing thet c contrarie himselfe pag line n pag li line worde god may also offer themselues vnto lordes supper affirme contrarie pag say magistrate ought compell papistes excommunicate person heare sermon pag affirme playner wordes shewing reason suche may admitted hearing worde yet participation lordes supper lastly denie perswasion nourished suffering three foure communicate contrarie rather godly example fewe may eyther prouoke rest like diligence else confounde make ashamed especially eyther godly exhortation conteyned booke bee read vnto otherwise put minde slacknesse godly carefull minister circumstance excepted rest matter part agree chap diuision c page sect vpon eyther contempt superstitious feare drawne papistes lenton preparation fortie dayes eare line hrift displing c commeth passe men receyuing supper lord seldome fall sicke must haue supper ministred vnto theyr house otherwise euery weeke receyued shoulde breede suche vnquietnesse cannot come receyue although haue shewed neuer receyued yet priuate receyuing hand suffered thus hauing declared thinke faultie communion booke poynt reason withall answered eyther doctor alledgeth place likewise page touching matter come nowe vnto called iewish purifying admonition seruice booke afore tyme purifycation woman io whitgifte see howe poynt true lenton fast vsed communion diligently often frequented indeede rare seldome receyuing came priuate massing beginning long lenton fast receyue euery weeke thing wished might conueniently bee yet notwithstanding communion denyed sicke oftentymes commeth passe men infirmitie sicknesse able come churche whole monethes yeares whome weekely communicating coulde nothing helpe agaynst reason debarre seale god promise effectuall maner kinde applying death christ vnto themselues assurance forgiuenesse sinnes sacrament comfort especially tyme extremitie sicknesse desirous thus haue declared thinke faultie communion booke poynt reason force reason iustly poynt charge booke reader may iudge churching woman chap diuision c pag sect vlt churching woman title yet kept seemeth hid great partleuit iewish purification like olde law brought forth child holdensrife wordes vncleane vntill time came temple shewe hirselfe brought forth man woman terme churching hir seeme import nothing else banishment certaine excommunication churche space betwene time hir deliuerie hir comming vnto church doth else churching implie restoring hir vnto church cannot without barre shutting forth presupposed also called thankes giuing principall tytle whiche directorie part liturgie placed top leafe translator best lyked churching woman passe haue come nigh communion table may came high aultar bicause spoken generally agaynst ceremony iewish approcheth nearest iewish purifycation commaunded offer accustomed offrings wherein besydes verie worde offering caryeth strong sent suspition sacryfice especially vttered symply without addition cannot without daunger booke maketh custome popish churche corrupt rule measure offering although meaning booke offring sinne yet maner speaking may stumbling stocke way ignorant simple wicked obstinate thereby confirmed hardned corruptious best answered case reliefe minister remembred first minister lyueth offrings secondarily payment minister wage conuenient eyther church people thirdly thereby fall fault condemne poperie besydes ordinarie liuing appoynted seruice priest whole tooke theyr seuerall seruices masse baptisme burying churching c seuerall rewardes thing seruice booke well abolished certains thing cannot see good cause shoulde reteine certaine io whitgifte propertie quarellers men naturally bent contention striuestryfe wordes proper quarellers wordes termes cannot reproue thing matter selfe fault pretended one toucheth matter booke onely tytle top leafe coming woman neare communion table paying accustomed offrings curate place reproued matter great importance themselues worth talking yet beeing comely decent order prescribed church may contemned despysed without crime stubbornnesse disobedience quarelling may rather appeare answere cauilles wordes first title thankes giuing woman childbirth commonly called churching woman sir see proper tytlethe people hardly broght leaue accustomed termes thankes giuing woman childebirth common name customably vsed common people taught speake man keepe accustomed name termes therefore call lordes day sunday next day vnto monday prophane ethnicall name yet nothing derogating dayes tymes lykewise call morning euening prayer mattens euensong neyther brought contrarie yet prayer worse call day christes natiuitie christmasse c condemne thing themselues say terme doth import nothing else banishment church c might say name sunday monday import yt dedicate day sunne moone likewise might say name reteyned comon vsuall speache men would espie folly euen may nowe disposed absence woman hir delyuerie neyther banishment excommunication terme withdrawingthe true cause absence woman hir deliuerace partie churche reason infirmitie daunger god hath layde vpon woman kinde punishment first sinne whiche daunger knoweth whether shall escape therefore shee hath onelye escaped also brought childe worlde encrease god people tyme comelinesse nature maye beare commeth firste intothe cause hir thankesgiuing churche giue thankes deliueraunce christe sinne whereof infirmitie perpetuall testimonie done iewishly christianly custome duty make act lawfull matrimonie vncleane giue thankes god deliueraunce manifolde perilles christian hearte name sake thus disallowe doe comming neare communion table verye small matter carpe thought moste conuenient place minister woman especially disposed receiue holy communion trifling quarrel argue extreame penurie good substantiall reason paying hir accustomed offrings seeme moste mislike selfe confesse meaning booke hath purpose intent would make reader beleue neither neither offereth lambe turtle orleuit yong pigeon lawe requireth payeth curate accustomed dutie may lawfully giue receiue tenthes may payde receyued portion pastor liuing appointed limitted vnto hym churche therefore may lawfully receiue appointed vnto obiections contrary hereby answered fully chap diuision admonition booke great number thing contrary god worde conteyned iewish act purifyings c ansvvere admonition pag sect thirde iewishe purifyings terme cite purpose act peter speaking certeyne pharisies beleued taught nedeful gentile conuerted circumcised obserue moses lawe saith sorte novve therefore vvhy tempte ye godact laye yoke disciple neckes c howe thing conteined prohibiteth woman deliuered great danger paynes child bearing giue congregation thankes deliuerance let godly reader iudge surely iewishe purifying christian giuing thankes consonant agreable worde god hereof also thing spoken place c pag lin nowe whereas doctor sayth place actes alleaged admonition maketh nothing haue considered iewyshe ceremony suppose abolished vtterly shewed ceremonial law moses done awaye sauiour christe also parte thereof muste needes therein comprysed io whitgifte place nothing perteyneth purpose neither giuing thankes iewysh ceremonie therefore supposition vayne chap diuision c pag midst whereas sayth nothing else thankesgiuing hit deliuerance cannot therefore christian godly answere solemne expresse giuing thankes churche euery benefite either equall greater singular persone churche doth receyue wee onelye haue preaching thetheod li cap worde ministring sacramentes shoulde haue much leysure doe corporall bodely worke lyke vnto heretykes called syriake worde messalians continuall prayer nothing else daungers encrease god people thing publike although thankes giuen priuate person dede punishmet daunger layde vpon womankinde disobedience onely common notorious perpetuall testimonie subiection vnto synne therefore requireth solemne thankesgiuing time pleaseth god shewe mercie therein deliuer ill yet reade priuate persone forbidden giue thankes publike congregation especiall benefit receiued would haue taught hym bringing vsurping without authoritie ceremony congregation earnester matter may iested weightier permitted vnto discretion euery woman consydering hath bene horribly abused tyme malitiousnesse c therefore maye celebrate feaste easter yeare denye argument obseruing easter doth rather put v mynde doctrine gospell drawe v nere consyderation benefites wee haue receyued death passion resurrection christe suppose fewe godlye disposed christian doe thynke moste conuenient profitable feastes especiallye shoulde bee churche reteyned neyther euerye contentious person magistrate law line authoritie giue people muche carnall libertie man take away libertie driue necessarie rest body io whitgifte god gaue libertie commaundement appoynt solemne feast dayes besides sabboth feast easter pentecoste tabernacle c withoute restraynte libertie therefore interpretation giuen page place dothe leaue euery priuate man free libertie agaynst authoritie magistrate churche giueth libertie rather suche authoritie churche appoynt therin shall conuenient magistrate hathe power authoritie ouer subiectes externallthe magistrate hathe authoritie abridge externall libertie libertie taken away matter bodily affayres wherefore maye call bodily labour compell vnto shall thought moste conuenient libertie god giueth man whyche man oughte take hym woulde libertie conscience worldly affayres bodily businesse gouerned magistrate lawes doctrine licentious tendeth muche carnall corporall libertie deede perillous doctrine state one title god worde dothe constrayne eyther magistrate churche turning carnall libertie spiritual seruice god bodily labour diuine worship doe cause men abstayne corporall labour maye heare worde god worship congregation whye maye churche well restrayne working anye parte daye maye doe moste parte confesse power churche appoynte many dayes weeke yeare whiche congregation shoulde assemble heare worde god receyue sacramentes offer vp prayer haue answered teaching lande order whiche yet taken come parte whiche haue dronke poyson taughte yet good name abolished shoulde helpe vnteache whiche preaching teacheth behalfe io whitgifte haue dismembred booke taking heere peece peece answere pleaseth leauing oute liste rather make newe discourse owne replie anye thyng haue set downe touching name holydayes whiche mislike haue tolde cause called whiche cause improue therefore fall agayne accustomed coniectures supposition whiche simple slender argumentes euery one dothe vnderstande muche muste churche alter hir decree order euery prophane name yet suppose man madde thinke dayes instituted vsed christian honour sunne moone saturne play parte quareller haue sundry time tolde cauill name reproue matter dayes rather reteyned commodity receyue whereby doctor goeth proue goodnesse lawfulnesse institution scripture read expounded patience sainctes persecution martyrdome edifying churche remembred yearely renued saye mighte haue commodity without daungers whiche haue spoken without keeping yerely memorie saincts falleth better profitable sorte sayde absurdly keeping easter tyeth fettereth meditation easter sewe dayes whiche shoulde reache age tyme lyfe celebration memory sainctes martyr streyghten consideration vnto dayes whych continually thought dayly long lyue thoughte good profitable thing remembraunce shoulde vpon dayes wherein supposed haue dyed yet followeth therefore thys remembraunce celebrated hearing scripture concernyng prayer made followe constancie rest daye shoulde kepte holy suche sorte men tabernacle eche seuen dayes annexed vnto wyll adde iudiths feast chap machabies feast macha chap whiche continued eyght dayes togither hesters feast chap whiche continued two dayes shall finde holydayes short number far hauing double many spirite acquaynted suche vntrue assertion saye mighte haue commodity without daungers c well waye whiche whole churche hathe tyme tyme allowed way whiche certayne particular person owne heades haue deuysed nothing haue saye agaynst dayes onely name memory martyr strayghten consideration vnto dayes c men inhibited bodily labour serue god al haue answered latter parte confesse woulde haue certayne dayes appoynted publike prayer celebration sacrament hearing worde seeme deny remembrance saincts martyr may kepte onely mislike rest day men debarred bodily labour exercising dayly vocation wel perceeue something woulde finde faulte knewe bounde labour appeareth lawes churche may doe necessarie businesse deede farre scrupulositie thys poynte punishmentes appoynted keepe number worldly affayres time publike prayer preaching worde yet see cause maye iustly wholly debarred excepte vrgent occasion require sometime contrarie bodily labour suche dayes housholders bounde duetie well instruct family pastor bounde instructe conuenient tyme suche dayes haue suche regarde worldly affayres commodious abstayne wholly worke vpon holydayes fall twice thrice euery weeke halfe daye therefore reason worldly weake bothe respect god worlde also imagination keeping easter dothe fetter meditation easter aa bayne reason fewe dayes c likewyse reste holydayes haue answered moste vayne reason mighte well saye oughte certayne tymes appoynted receyuing holy communion bycause meditation death passion christe application fettered certayne dayes whiche shoulde continually thoughte dayly long lyue mighte saye likewyse sabboth daye oughte knowe especiall celebrating memorie christes resurrection yeare fettering meditation thereof daye onely receyuing communion moneth strayghting consideration deathe passion christe time onely wherein receyue holy sacrament reason muste eyther haue suche memory celebrated time time wyse men consider howe farre wander want reason chap diuision ansvvere admonition pag sect ierome writing vpon chap galatian sayth thisierome sorte lavvfull obserue dayes moneths time yeres vve also fall like fault vvhich obserue passion christ sabboth day time lent feast easter pentecoste time appoynted martyr according maner custome euery nation vvhich vvill ansvvere simply vvill say obseruing dayes vvith ievvish obseruing vve doe celebrate feast vnleuened bread resurrection death christe c least confused gathering togither people diminishe fayth christ therfore certayne dayes appoynted vve might meete togither one place bicause dayes holy intent vvhat day soeuer vve meete vve may reioyce see one another c augustine lyke manner lib de ciuitate dei cap sayth vve honoraugustine memory martyr holy men suche haue striuen truthe euen death c augustine boke contra adamantum manachaei discip ca expounding woordes apostle ye obserue dayes yeares tymes wryteth thus one may thinke speaketh church theyr time holy dayes kepte besides lordes day might haue also cyted ignatius tertullian cyprian greater aunctencie would haue made credite cause seing measureth truthe almoste whole booke crooked measure yarde tyme denied keeping holydayes especially easter pentecoste auncient holydayes remembraunce martyr vsed long tyme abuse auncienter grosser also haue declared easie shewed neede required therefore vnlearned shifte appeale example scripture example perfectest churche euer apostle tymes io whitgifte knowe might haue alleaged many authority proofe ofthe repliee appealeth ito churche place cited epistle galatian collossians mention holydayes eyther sainctes appeareth also defendeth church churche geneua answereth obiecte keping sainctes dayes holydayes called besides lordes daye whiche woulde haue lordes day kepte still day reste bodily labour may appeare place vpon collossians especially alleaged institution meaneth nothing lesse holydayes take vpon detende may appeare first place collossians sayeth dayes reste whiche vsed vsed pollicie sake nowe well knowne pollycie way preserue estate thinges keepe good continuance successe well beastes menne labour sixe dayes rest seuenth tendeth pollicie wealth people preseruation good order shoulde many dayes wherein menne cease worke beyng thing breedeth idlenesse consequently pouertie besides disorder vice alwayes go companie idlenesse place institution declareth himselfe yet playnely sayeth odde holydayes without superstition ordeyned onely obseruing discipline order whereby giueth vnderstande would haue holydayes tyme bestowed exercise discipline order churche reste altogither dayes free laboured appeareth holydayes ascribed vnto sainctes seruice booke iuste cause man cannot safely without exception subscribe vnto seruice booke io whitgifte soeuer caluines practise churche geneua yet place dothe iudgement euidently appeare neyther doth man alwayes vse himselfe alloweth may circumstance make commendable one place condemneth thing vnlawfull muste also condemne church vse though wholly yet poynt muche therefore caluine condemne church obseruing suche dayes manifest argument condemned obseruing dayes church deede one thing mislike thing condemne maketh suche sturre churche matter disorderly sayde onely mislyke also condemne place caluine epistle galat mente onely lordes daye dayes also obserued reformed church place maketh generall answere soone perceyued suche reade place also shall per vse woordes vpon seconde chapter collossians shall finde lyke sense sayeth vsed order pollicie wee dissent thinke lyke manner howbeit wee vnderstande doth ecclesiasticall order pollicie wordes go place galatian sayeth obseruing dayes dothe also perteyne ad regimen ecclesiae tyme wherfore fully persuaded cometh nerer fulfilling mynd apostle diligetly studying labouring continually knowledge doth orderly learnedly effectually preach moneth tha backbiting men table running day long vp downe stretes seldome neuer studying negligently vnorderly verbally may terme preach euery day twice yet know oftner man doth preach former circumstance considered better euery one required according talent speaketh laboureth speak preacheth often preacheth moste painfully truly diligently shall day beste accepted learned auncient father whithead hath sundry time lamented
