would faine seemeth durste interprete diligent preaching preaching season season preaching moneth bicause dare say directly compasseth first putteth case one preaching twice day verbally wyth small substance matter preachyng moneth doth pythyly orderly discretely concludeth suche sermon monethe nearer mynde apostle sermon made twice euery daye yet case cleare maketh grauntyng calleth verball sermon haue goodnesse edifying must simple slender meate better beyng giuen euery day best dayntiest meate onely moneth one man may liue although lyking fed afterward fai line shed case put monethly long laboured sermon called haue little lesse good wholsome doctrine sermon whiche preached euery daye assuredly moste goe long sermon whyche knowe haue hearde come bryng foorthe bryng foorth oftentymes wy line e vnprofytable matter good tymely frute holesome substantiall doctrine maruell therein worde god fulfilled whiche declareth talentes god gift grace encreased co line tinuall vse laying side diminished ende taken quite away suffered lie long rusting digged ground io whitgifte doctor wordes hee playne youre dealyng wyth obscure whyche haue spoken verball sermon notoriously knownethere like reason externall spirituall foode bee true haue sayde monethly sermon referre men iudgemente similitude betwixte externall meate feedeth bodie woorde god feedeth soule dothe fayle manye thyngs especially meate bodie remayneth stomacke passeth thorough worde god continueth indureth mynde euer meate bodie better digested lesser whyle dothe continue worde god better vnderstoode remembred longer remaineth meat bodie taken serueth ye present time bee neuer good holesome worde god preached faythfully receyued dothe nourishe feede continually therefore one learned effectuall orderly sermon preached moneth conteyneth nouryshemente feedeth longer woorketh heartes hearer edifyeth vnorderlye verball sermon myght also adde contentious preache one whole yeare compare worde god nutriment body togyther grosest manner wherein nothing like thinke monethly long laboured sermon call skilleth much heate hindreth true iudgemente woulde haue vnderstande whiche speake monethly sermon speake compar line son woulde haue man otherwise able preach moneth haue shewed contrary answer euery man shall render accompt laboure according talent wherefore company greatly delighted spreading false rumor men seeke win credite vnto selues diffaming shall answer one day god great iniurie haue done behalfe lawfull boast selfe might iustly saye proue haue preached many sermon god forgiue boasting compell well confesse haue done ought haue done beseech god graunt longer life ioy worlde desire vigilante profitable churche woulde dumbe without function vppon occasion goodes englande surely preache able called therevnto shall haue hard iudgement shall become suche onely preache themselues deface men preache backbiting slaundering spreading abrode false rumour vpon discredite person doctrine sectes schismes rent peeces church christ violently plucke downe whatsoeuer men haue builded c thing would considered time seconde diuision c pag sect heere doctor taketh occasion vtter stomacke agaynste london flynging one syde agaynste woman syde agaynste minister whose diligence bycause maketh doctor negligence appeare darke dus line colour matched whiche cleare lightsome doth goe aboute deface vntrue slaunderous surmyse loose negligente vnprofitable preachyng one two london line greate iniurie therefore charge indefinitely companye minister london besydes doctor dothe see howe fyrste accuseth bishop euer beaware bothe ordeyning suche minister reforming beyng farre order archbishop whiche doth require disorder bishop hande sayeth godlie heauenly order haue one bishop ouer many minister one archebishop ouer dyuers bishop shall esteeme pythinesse fastnesse preachyng frutes knowledge sear god people london faythfull true heart toward prince realme thynk termeth loose vnprofitable preachyng wit fal waightyer leaue deeper printe behynde monethly sermon whyche speaketh tte minister london better minister whiche preache twice day whiche make word god nouell daynties latimer pleasantly sayd strawberies commyng certayne tymes yeare io whitgifte speake fyrste authours admonition reporte whithead saying dyuers preacher london whiche coulde haue improued thynke woulde knowe manye graue learned wyse go line preacher london whyche haue greately profited place instrumentes haue wroughte good effectes speake heartes many line knowe also others farre vnlyke vnto respect vndiscreate loose dealyng haue muche line yeth wroughte contrarie haue bene suffered eyther throughe negligence archebishop bishop excuse neyther thinke haue good cause take better heed hereafter touching woman london haue sayde thyng disprayse knowe number verie honeste godlie knowe none euyll onely require modestie beseemeth sober matrones woman pro line essyng gospell seemely woman speake churche whiche good muche lesse comely hir sc line lde openly streates common deprauer others table meeting cause shoulde beare stomacke london whiche place haue alwayes honoured haue many friendes whych haue shewed many token good one man abilitie admonishe citezens bidde take heede abuse gospell serue theyr affection make cloke theyr contention waxe wearie desire straunge doctrine heape vp suche preacher vnto themselues maye serue theyr humour shewe themselues thankfull gospell whyche haue long receyued studye peace quietnesse grieue prince seekyng alteration whome enioy pure worde god true vse sacramentes syncers woorshyppyng hym shorte moue brotherly loue true obedience theyr superiours hatred sectes schismes whervnto diuers much drawne vtter stomacke agaynst eyther take answere must obey god rather man preferre prince friendes peece rhetorike drawe hatred doubt godlie easyly espie iudge spirite accordingly thirde diuision admonition nay fulnesse blasphemie haue sayde muche preachyng bryngeth worde god contempt foure preacher inough london farre thinking necessarie seeking euery congregation haue faithfull pastor answere admonition pag sect haue mislyked often preachyng hane sayde mucheuerball preacher preachyng bryngeth worde god contempte foure preacher inough london blamed iustely booke willeth man say hath sayd vse preach often loose negligente verball vnlearned sermon haue brought worde god contempte foure godlie learned pithy diligent discreete preacher might good london fortie contentious vnlearned verball rashe preacher haue sayde truely saying myghte well iustifyed howbeit take heede slaunder man vniustly seeke discredite whylest seeke vtter youre malice godlie booke none fauoureth god word thinke denyeth hearing worde god vsuall ordinarie meanes whereby god vseth woorke faythe v therfore preacher necessarie c page lin thing doctor speaketh agayne page effect altogether almoste wordes io whitgifte yet somthing would haue bin answered take graunted whiche answered fourth diuision admonition seuententh eightenth nothing taught god word prince pleasure me deuises popish ceremony antichristian rite publike pulpit defended sought phil seeke theyrs ansvvere admonition pag sect bin wel let v vnderstand prince pleasuresthe churche englande slaundered admonitors men deuises popish ceremony antichristia rite nowe haue slandered prince whole state religion churche publike authoritie established wherfore vntil shew particular shal answere spiritus dei ne que est mendax ne que mordax spirite god neyther lyer slaunderer pleasure thus generally say pastor soughte flock seeke well knowne bee pastours seeke flockes hitherto thanks vnto god al discourse ther one peece false doctrine substance ascribed churche orderly kind reasoning saye peter man borne haue two legges ergo euery man hathe two legges due forme reasoning euery man nature hath two legges peter man therfore nature hath two legges therefore argumente bin framed thys sort office euery minister gospell preach baptisme iohn peter thomas minister gospell ergo ought preach baptisme bin good order touching forme though matter ther bin fault purpose onelye deede whiche sense paule sayth seuered mother wombe notwithstanding hee long tyme member sathan persecuting christ place sayeth grace giuen v christe euerlasting tymes agayne god loued peryshe whiche member christe godlye sorowefulnesse may cause repentance eyther fleshe olde man dying spirite may saued daye lorde therefore whome call excommunicated two respectes member churche one according men bycause excluded holy felowship faythfull according god bycause saying christe sure bounde heauen whiche ryghtlye bounde churche earth thyng truelye bee bounde heauen bee cast true kyngdome heauen whiche neuer happeneth anye electe saying christe standeth shall neuer bee caste whome father hath giuen sonne lohn bene v woulde haue taried v apostle foundation god standeth sure hauing seale lorde knoweth line therefore touching christe sayd member churche firste whiche reprobate damned bycause tyme concernyng force efficacie spirite without hym beyng engraffed hym receyue lyuelye nouryshement spirite christe tyme tyll grace repentaunce gyuen conclude difference betwixt firste betweene legge woode ioyned cunninglye true bodye whiche notwithstanding legge deede neyther truely called parte man betwyxt true legge yet tyme receyueth nouryshement suche sorte vnles refreshed strengthe sharpe medicine wyll necessaryly putrific cleane peryshe vvherefore seeing thinges thus charitie byddeth v hope well yea also take care whiche helde captiues snare deuyll god forbydde parentes beyng excommunicated wee conclude theyr posteritie belongeth kyngdome god furthermore great difference betweene whiche although bee notorious offendours neuerthelesse departe churche betweene manifeste rennegates ioyning selues enimies oppresse truthe gospell vnreasonable esteeme papistes muche lesse christian excommunicated otherwise turkes although bee vnpossible serue pope christ togyther yet certayne poperie erring christian churche vvherefore lorde hath middest goulfe papistrie tim rule well worthy double honour especially whiche labour worde doctrine maketh playne expresse wordes two sortes elder one whiche doth gouerne teache gouerneth onely therefore senior meant whose office helping pastor bishop gouernment particular churche placed pastor elder io whitgifte rare matter handling thing first entreate natura posterius see commonly vsed logician firste treate parte commaundement without spot blemish vntil appearing lord iesus christ weight sentence obseruing thing mentioned epistle may better vnderstanded note word seuerally first therfore noted saith denounceor thirdly maketh mention line e liuing god christ witnessed good profession vnder pontius pilate sheweth thing conteyned epistl maintenance thereof ought doubt giue liues suche ought keepe haue without strife without sweate easely keeping haue obteyning haue say line ur honour commodi line y wealth haue sayd liues oughte deare vnto v therefore doth make mention confession christ vnto death might shew v example foorthwith speaketh god whiche rayseth dead thys meanes might comfort timothie brought trouble de line ense thing fourthly referre word without spot blemish vnto commaundement part absolue woulde noted vnto mee might fynde saying sainte augustine moste people infected faulte punished excommunication excommunication oughte bee attempted bicause sufficient number voyces obteined churche alter chaunge determine appoynt thing matter religion without aduise counsayle dissention among shall prince determine controuersies constantinus theodosius godly emperours wherefore meetnesse priest bishop doth take away authoritie godly prince matter church diuision c pag lin doctor nothing el appeare shake hand papistes papistes would exempt priestes subiection punishment ciuill magistrate ye papist would whatsoeuer cleargy doth determine sorthwith shoulde holden good prince shoulde foorthwith compelled mayntayne set forth good euill without inquitie saye eiher times hawe proue lawfull ministerie set good order ruinous decayes ouerthrowes religion prince ought lawfull ministerie shall agree vnlawfull vnmeete order prince ought stay order suffer driue whiche lawfull meete shake handes papistes doctor blame whiche hath taught v twise appoynting ceremony churche belongeth vnto churche yet knowe one two later writer thinke otherwise take aduantage authoritie thinke ought preiudiced thinke otherwise muche haue doctor yet iudgement churche ceremony shoulde ordeyned church trauayle matter considering practise churche commonly referre matter vnto ecclesiasticall replier giueth prince potestatem facti take better holde shall please go forewarde determination cannot agree among selues see authoritie haue giuen ciuill magistrate determine matter ought espie senior disposed peeuishe eyther muste prince haue religion el shall appoynt vnto potestatem facti giue make executioner potestatem iuris fully remoue papist hath say authoritie make order lawes authoritiethe replier vttreth strage doctrine proofe yet woulde haue proued scripture ample large matter religion lawfull ministerie vnlawfull ministerie deede hath one may safely vse aduise followe howe place applyed caluine teacheth like wise wordes following nunc applicanda est comparatio ad rem praesentem quod quisquis vult sub christo mil line e relictis omnibus mundi tricis auocamentis se illi totum sua que studia addi line ere novve comparation applied present purpose vvhosoeuer vvill playe vvarriour vnder christe leauing vvorldely matter impediment muste giue selfe vvholly vnto therefore genetall perteyneth christian chiefly especially minister worde maye occupie selues worldly businesse men muste marchaunts husbandman craftes men hinder vocation withsome ciuill office rather helpes hinderance bishop suche lyke worldly affayres suche ciuill office committed rather helpes vocation impediment office iustice peace highe commissioner suche like punishe vice iniquitie see good order kepte common wealth aswell matter touching religion common publike businesse wherefore office meere ciuill partely ecclesiasticall discipline correction sinnes opinion meete committed wysest best cleargie ende suche word conuenient dyscipline may copelled dueties neyther office accounted worldly affayres rather heauenly spirituall forasmuche serue mayntenance religion godlynesse suppressing sinne wickednesse true augustine sayth seruiunt reges christo leges ferendo pro christo also true seruiunt episcopi christo leges exequendo pro christo c pag midst last place whych alleaged admonition epistle tim sheweth muche state minister souldiour therefore the2 epist souldiour ende might better please captayne doe seruice warfare quitteth thing whych loueth wherof otherwyfe might haue care might enio line euen minister ought dispatche selfe thing whiche maye let office ministerie although might otherwyse lawfully vse performing ministerie full must quite thing whiche may lawfully vse howe muche might admonition conclude ought entangle selfe thing place luke romaine shewed vnlawfull meddle although doctor say sentence generall yet particularly ment properly minister caluine teacheth doctor place hath cited authoritie twice purpose althoughe caluine doe apply prescript word sentence proue minister ought meddle ciuill office dothe followe therfore place vsed thereto saying ought abstayne let may hinder vocation ministerie doth consequently say ought abstayne ciuill offyces doctor beene well read auncient doctor would seeme might haue knowne place vsed cyprian purpose alleaged heere cyprian speaking agaynst elder which9 epist lib line taken vpon executor one whiche dead alleageth place io whitgifte whiche spoken souldiour perteyneth christian well minister euery christian man souldiour ciuill function helpes ministerie may lawfully vsed haue sayde caluine truely interpreteth place interpretation maketh fully purpose directly agaynst reader may easily perceyue many word soone breuitie answered cyprian alleageth place good purpose executor troublesome matter dothe oftentimes hinder men calling somtimes euen temporall men call doe auoyde trouble thervpon commonly ensueth yet doubt whether woulde refuse executor offered vnto neyther doe thinke vnlawfull troublesomnesse much hinderance deede weightier matter chap diuision c pag tovvards ende reason admonition may added whych admonition hath page regiment church spirituall respecteth conscience therefore hath doe wyth ciuill office respect properly common wealth outwarde godly honest quiec behauiour therfore meanyng ciuill gouernour dothe vse suche kynde punishmente may brydle outwarde man holde hym dare offende open breache godlynesse honestie quietnesse paule commendeth1 tim line vnto v ecclesiasticall regiment dothe vse kynde discipline whereby conscience inwarde man may kepte wylling obedience vnto god commaundement touching godly honest quiet lyfe io whitgifte vpon gouernment substance therfore holy vniuersall great synode hath decreed none hereafter bishop clearke monke shall hyer possession intermeddle secular possession except lawe dryuen take tuition therefore meete exercise sayth thus businesse warfare market affayres marchandise huckster craft ouersight innes tauerns bathe exercise vnliberall craftes digge mettals stone burne lyme carie sande schauengers like haue yet proued god order broken ciuill office speake committed ecclesiasticall person iesting tauntes leaue professe cunning chap diuision c pag sect whereas sayth helpe maynteyneth religion deede reason thelib cap papistes caluin confuteth institution although good necessary punish vice iniquitie corporall punishmentes ciuill correction yet doth followe done minister followeth preachyng ministring sacramentes excommunication good necessarie therfore fitte executed ciuill magistrate graunt minister haue also punish vice ciuill magistrate punishe lighter faultes penaltie monie losse member church minister especially church hath punishe faultes reprehension rebuke ciuill magistrate punisheth greater faultes death minister haue interest hath ye sworde excommunication power kill rebellious cut churche doth common wealth helpe minister office shoulde meddle ciuill punishment help vnto magistrate office excommunicate thinges perteyning ecclesiasticall discipline io whitgifte woordes doth caluine confute reason cut matter shorte booke chapt instit haue quoted margent reason either alleaged confuted section speaketh agaynst temporall dominion popish bishop whiche deriue excessiue power ciuill magistrate fco pope cloking pretence ornament beutie kingdome christ far thing alleaged conuenient bishop haue ciuill authoritie committed vnto would gladly heare reason corporall punishment lawfull samuell kill agag office saule lawfull saule offer vp sacrifice office samuell office function mynister owne power commit list office ciuill magistrate may comitted soeuer shal1 sam please best like thinke fitte gouernment1 sam true excomunication ecclesiastical censure mynisterexcommunication punishment vsed church gualter may exercise state church beare reprehension discipline lawfull euery christian vse onely censure ciuill magistrate may appoynt shall state church moste conuenient know gualter sayeth cor romaine bishop vpon place like haue grounded excommunication effectuall instrument tyrannie whereby haue cruelly vexed onely priuate men also kinges emperours haue bene cause ciuill warres sedition euen anabaptist whilest perswade themselues discipline without excomunication trouble church euery make theselues laughing stockes world c let euery church follovve kinde discipline vvhich meete countrie vvherein liue vvhich may moste commodious respect time place let man rashly prescribe vnto seeke binde men one forme old time hath bene kinde punishment either reprehensios excomunication may appeare euen canon attributed apostle haue rehearsed punishment appoynted depriuation also canon diuerse councels say helpe minister office meddle ciuill punishmets helpe magistrate office excommunicate c answere soone made magistrate may corporall punishment minister ecclesiasticall discipline neither man desperate magistrate authoritie may brydle ye time fewe regarde greatest censure church chap diuision c pag sect whereas doctor sayeth may husband men craftes men c yet may haue ciuill office thinke far otherwise although neyther lawfull yet one tollerable seing ministerie worde calling vnder sunne weightier requireth greater exercise minde officeof magistrate agaynst reason lay heauie burthen vpon man already loden hath much able beare equall needes adde vnto weight burthen laye lighter charge exercising handy crafte breake backe charge ciuill magistrate io whitgifte wdrldly affayres husbandrie occupation c must needes withdrawe booke make vnapt dutie incident office meete calling ciuill office speake meete calling perteyning discipline helpes office function haue sayde wherefore farre breaking backe make rest burthen great deale easier chap diuision c pag sect whereas pollicie doctor seemeth furtherance gospell ioyne togither also pollicie idolater haue declared wisedome god hath seemed farre otherwise doubt therfore separate ministerie pompe commendable ciuill magistrate least efficacie power simplicitie worde god ministerie obscured whilest men would attribute conuersion soules vnto gospell due vnto worde spirite god glorious shewes least whilest minister haue word one hande swordem men able iudge well conscience mightie operation worde god might doubte themselues whether outwarde shewe minister caried stroke beleuing worde io whitgifte one reason conteyned place effect minister shoulde enioy ciuill function men would attribute conuersion soules vnto shewes ought therefore c denie maior fonde vaine imagination reason frame sorte mynister haue ciuill ecclesiasticall power men able iudge conscience mightie operation worde god might doubt whether feare outward shewe minister carriedthe repliers argument siniteth well magistrate ecclesiasticall stroke c vayne imagination may aptly applied agaynst authoritie ciuill magistrate agaynst ciuill iurisdiction minister yea deede serue ouerthrow kinde ciuill punishment magistrate make sharpe lawes comming churche hearing woorde god contemning religion like men meanes driuen heare woorde god c length conuerted may doubt whether woorde hath wrought feare outwarde punishment marke still smiteth magistrate percey line te neare approcheth opinion anabaptistes would haue kinde discipline church excommunicationgod vseth corporall punishment meanes saluation answere briefly god vseth corporall punishment meanes driue euen elect hearing worde god honestie lyfe vseth also brydle wicked exaples men might learne beware themselues also may kepte order man truly conuerted preaching woorde doubt god working spirite thorough ministerie woorde hath wrought good though externall meanes feare punishment lyke first enforced heare woorde keepe himselfe order deede reason force magistrate might put vp sworde especially ecclesiasticall matter might minister lay aside authoritie also least thing ascribed vnto glaunce also pollicy idolater though haue proued yet haue answered chap diuision c pag sect vlt doctor sayth ciuill office counted worldly affayres heauenly spirituall yet compared ecclesiasticall office may called secular office much gether care religion procure prouide thing whereby may quietly commodiously liue ecclesiasticall office immediatly onely bente procure glory god saluation men signification heauenly spirituall take marchandise husbandry handycrafte heauenly spirituall although declaratur longae tamen preces hic non damnatur sed quae vanae sunt inanes super line titiosae longa enim non est oratio qua nihil redundat centrum vero breuis esse non potest quae non proficiscitur ex line nimo pio fideli bablers full word nonlatin alphabet wherby thing signified yet long prayer heere condemned vayne fond superstitious long prayer wherin nothing much side short proceedeth godly faithfull mind true interpretation worde nonlatin alphabet appearetherasmus followeth place nonlatin alphabet thinke heard muche babling upon whiche word erasmus giueth note hic non est nonlatin alphabet sed proprio vsus est verbo nonlatin alphabet veluti exponens quid dixerit nonlatin alphabet heere worde nonlatin alphabet vseth proper worde nonlatin alphabet expounding mente nonlatin alphabet see therfore one word expeudeth surest way interpreting caluine vpo place sayth thus porro eoru stultitia reprehendit caluine chris line u qui vt deu persuadea line exorent multum verborum sufficient proofes bee induce necessitie kynde gouernment greatly vrged let learned reader iudge c excommunication pertayneth one man churche caluine institution booke chapter section teacheth excommunication porteyneth one man wicked facte one man taking authoritie common hymselfe alone opened waye tyrannie tooke churche hir right abrogated church senate ordeined spirite christe chapter section sayeth ought done without knowledge approbation churche io whitgifte wee graunte one man ought take vnto hym selfe doth apperteyne vnto haue proued tract excommunication perteineth byshops church england hath consented vnto wherefore ca line uine speaketh excommunication whiche pope violently tyrannically vsurpeth whiche bishoppes churche englande lawes god consent churche exercise speake thing selfe abuse c beza confession chapter section sayeth power excommunicating giuen one man except please god worke extraordinarily peter martyr vpon firste corinthes fifth chapter sayeth daungerous permitte waighty matter excommunication discretion wil one man therefore tyrannie might auoyded censure execeuted greater fruite grauitie order whiche apostle vseth still obserued io whitgifte beza martyr answere dyd caluine yet martyr seemeth expounde hym selfe place hee speakyng committing authoritie excommunicating pope one bishop refelling saying papistes episcopum esse totam ecclesia virtualiter rather tora ecclesia vitialiter affirmeth addeth de mali haec intelligas tyrannice agentibus vnderstande euill dishops deale tyrannically whereby declareth speaketh agaynst whether whole church may haue doe excommunication whither consent therof al tymes therein required meaning apostle place corinth haue declared tract c chauncellours commissary official c vsurpe iurisdiction io whitgifie caluin place alledgeth reason al office sayth exercise part bishop charge handle matter perteyne spirituall iurisdiction say speaketh doth proue rest section intreateth abuse officer wherein doe dissent c beza h booke diuorces prouing iudiciall deciding matrimoniall cause apperteyneth vnto ciuill magistrate sayth official proctor end promoter worde swinish filth long time hath wasted church io whitgifte vnderstande reason beza place proueth iudiciall deciding matrimoniall cause apperteyneth ciuill magistrate howbeeit official c case deale church englande without consent authoritie ciuill magistrate good dealing applie thing beza speake office abused vnder pope office nowe reformed vnder christian prince professeth gospell thus dazell people eye c peter martyr vpon chap romaine speaking ciuill iurisdiction bishop doth reason condemne deputy official io whitgifte peter martyr speaketh agaynst office agaynst certaine abuse officer simple dealing transferre office spoken abuse office c minister worde ought exercise line ill office iurisdiction caluin institution booke chap sect bringeth diuers reason proue bishop may neyther v line rpe take giuen eyther right sworde knowledge ciuill cause io whitgifte reason caluine vseth neyther many greatly strong haue answered fullie tract yet caluine speaketh onely princely power romishe bishop clayme committed vnto prince ciuill magistrate due vnto worde god chalenge haue shewed foresayde treatise howe farre bishop c beza confession chap sect sayth ecclesiasticall iurisdiction distinguished ciuill although bishoppes tymes christian emperours troubled hearing ciuill cause yet iudiciall power exercised friendly intreatie party whiche discorde sayth notwithstanding herein emperours giue much ambition certaine bishop wherevpon little little afterwarde thing confounded section sayth corporall punishment whiche apostle exercised peculiar extraordinarie io whitgifte beza bare worde sufficient proofe agaynst many testimony reason contrarie haue sufficiently shewed tract cap diuis vlt bishop tymes past onely heare ciuill cause also iudicially determine touching corporall punishment apostle exercised beza booke de haereticis magistratu puniendis doth make ordinarie vseth sufficient argument proue purpose sayth plainly apostle exercise punishment right ecclesiasticall ministerie right ciuill magistracie haue declared tract cap diuis c peter martyr vpon romanes speaking meeting ecclesiasticall ciuill iurisdiction one man sayth ciuill ecclesiasticall function meete one hynder exerciseth one cannot minister io whitegifte martyr speaketh absolute iurisdiction ciuill pope claymeth practised bishop church england whereof experience dayes king edwarde euen realme also allowed c bucer vpon matthew sayth man wise holy able exercise ciuill ecclesiasticall power therefore whiche exercise one must leaue io whitgifte answere martyr also allowed ciuill iurisdiction bishop england exercise time king edwarde c sacrament ought priuately administred woman foresayd confession c holdeth baptisme ought ministred woman midwyues also may ioyned liturgie english church geneua condemneth ministring eyther sacrament priuate house woman line whitgifte needlesse proofes yet learned cotrary iudgemet line ow beit man sayth woman may baptise ordinarily sacramonts may administred priuate place otherwise vpon vrgent occasion respecte learned man dothe condemne ministring sacramentes priuate place c peter martyr vpon chapter epistle corinthes describing corruption lordes supper noteth one churche communicate altogither corruption diuers place tymes past complayneth nowe io whitgifte martyr place speaketh agaynste priuate mass complainte maketh concerning wherein fully agree neyther doe like allowe suche withdrawe themselues lordes table supper celebrated neuer loue rehearse author wordes bycause make gather collection owne contrarie meaning author place reader shall easily perceiue wil please reade martyr place quoted surely great iniurie wreste order celebrating communion allowed church englande man else speaketh agaynst pryuate mass deepe profounde collection c bucer first booke kingdome christ chapter proueth corinthes whole churche shoulde receiue supper lorde togyther vse church god behalfe ought great diligent endeuour restored vnto church contempt mystery partaker called io whitgifte bucer speaketh nothing place touching question vnto agree woulde haue communion ministred publike congregation denyeth except vpon occasion sicknesse c haue declared woulde haue moste parte present communicate defendeth contrarie yet rest may secluded whole drift reproue communicate prohibite distribution supper willing moe fewer competent number may communion c beza vvestphalus sheweth decent baptisme ministred church standing houres minister vpo necessitie called ought ministred priuate house might ministred priuate house yet otherwise minister io whitgifte vntruely report beza wordes onely sheweth place order church remaineth doth prescribe certaine rule church neyther meete shoulde case speaketh baptizing priuate house doth simplie condemne soeuer iudgement poynt mynd sure bynde church thinke teach soundly sacrament doth though agree circumstance c caluin institution booke chapter sect proueth baptisme ought ministred priuate men woman io whitgifte minister church ye ordinarie minister baptisme neither may chalenge function vnto theselues ordinarily yet vpon occasion priuate person baptise baptisme good lawfull euen circumcision true circumcision ministred sephora haue proued tract cap c iudgement late writer touching ceremony apparell whose secrete epistle doctor alledgeth appeareth place following cited work printed published themselues wherof also alledged answerer examiner diuers place purpose wherevnto referre reader bucer vpon mathewe saith say nothing alwayes obiect greater thing must vrged reformation ceremony thereby defending reliques antichrist much ceremony testimony religion agreement betweene christe belial whiche sincere christian abide nothing antichrist io whitgifte bucer sayth truely reformation ceremony sought neglected neyther sincere christian abyde thing antichriste antichristes purpose reformation ceremony church englande whiche antichristian ceremony abandoned remaine purged al opinion antichristianitie bucer ment nothing lesse ceremony nowe reteined church englande vse maye euidently appeare whiche haue alledged tract cap diuision chap diuision c peter martyr vpon chap second boke king saith lutheran must take heede least whilest cutte many popishe error followe iehu reteining also many popish thing defende still reall presence bread supper image vestiments c saith religion must wholly reformed quick io whitgifte martyr nameth popishe thing lutheran obserue reall presence image popish apparell vsed masse doth meane church hath refused opinion apparell reteine haue declared tract chap diuision purpose speaketh concerning god thanked religion wholly reformed euen quicke churche c bullinger decade booke ninth sermon saythe sauiour christe apostle vsed accustomed apparell supper although tymes paste minister put kynde cloake vpon common apparell yet done neyther example chryste apostle tradition man ende example priestes apparell olde lawe caste vpon minister ministration supper sayth hee haue learned long agoe onely leuiticall ceremony abrogated also ought brought agayne churche man therfore seeing light gospell vnder shadowe lawe worthily reiecte massing leuiticall apparell io whitgifte neyther reteine massing leuiticall apparell apparell onely bullinger himselfe alloweth diuers epistle written purpose touching matter haue expressed tract chapter diuision c c gualter vpon actes among others bringeth one reason improue paules shauing head gospel beene preached twentie yeares therefore infirmitie iewes ought haue bene borne saith teacheth howe muche superstitious maisters ceremony hurte gospell nourishe weaknesse fayth long keping ceremony long bearing hinder doings minister feruent io whitgifte gualter wordes sayth nothing poynt churche speaketh truely nothing purpose gualter hath sufficiently shewed opinion matter onely written epistle printed bookes epistle commentary vpo first corinthian surely suche weight authority purpose take great aduauntage indeede cause opinion hath small credite alledging p imprinted london henry bynneman humfrey toy dvvelling paules churchyard signe helmet anno
